definition: lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support

sentences.english: Abandoned by the company, Peter's wife, Alice, must deal with it on her own.
sentences.chinese: 彼得被公司抛下不管，其妻艾莉丝惟有孤军奋战。

sentences.english: Remain kylin to fight bravely in an isolated force in this block battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 剩下麒麟在这个街区战场中孤军奋战。

sentences.english: The anti-Gaddafi forces acknowledge that they could not have done it alone.
sentences.chinese: 反对派也承认，他们不能只靠孤军奋战。

sentences.english: The Chinese government does not care what will happen, you are not alone.
sentences.chinese: 中国不会放手不管，你孤军奋战。

definition: It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
to put one's all into the fight
